ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Very slow after DirectX 9 patch
ygData.msgSnippet: I run win xp, geforce 4 128mb vid card on a 2.4ghz p4 with 512mb and started experiencing serious lag with the patch, I went and upgraded to 1gb and now only
ygData.messageBody:
I run win xp, geforce 4 128mb vid card on a 2.4ghz p4
with 512mb and started experiencing serious lag with
the patch, I went and upgraded to 1gb and now only
experience rare lag in pok and of course the bazarr.
Saving for a vid card with 256mb on it to see if that
helps to any great degree as well.
Iaeerwen
Druid of Tunare
The Nameless
--- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:
> I honestly think a lot of it has to do with system
> specs. I dont know why they woudl be experiencing
> any lag with DX9 with a P4 processor. I run a P4
> 1.8Ghz with 1GB of RAM and a 128MB video card. I
> very rarely lag. Sometimes int he Bazaar when its
> crowded, and sometimes in POK when people are Mass
> Group Buffing. Other than that, it's quite smooth.
> And this is with Spell Particles turned on with full
> opacity and clip plane at 100%.
>
> I'm wondering if the person might be running Windows
> ME because I do know that I had a lot more lag when
> I ran EQ under WinME, but when I upgraded to Windows
> XP it seemed to work miracles for reducing lag.
> That's about the only thing I could see that may
> make a difference. I also have a 2nd PC which is
> relatively the same specs, except its a 1.6Ghz.
> Same thing still applies though. Very little lag.
>
> Maybe that's the difference? The OS you use?
>
> Raido Covenfall
> 55 ELF DRU
> Cazic Thule server
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Melanie Johnson
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, March 29, 2004 12:52 PM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Very slow after
> DirectX 9 patch
>
>
> I've not been playing for a while now, but this
> has made me curious.
>
> I upgraded to DX9 last summer so I could play SWG.
> Then I started playing EQ again last fall, still
> using DX9. I didn't notice any difference, just my
> usual lag in PoK and the bazaar. So, is it the DX9
> that's messing everyone up, or some "upgrade" that
> SOE did to the graphic engine?
>
> arthiliel_tintalle <arthiliel@...> wrote:
> Su,
>
> Before buying a new video card as someone else
> suggested, I would
> try installing the new 56.64 drivers from NVIDIA
> first. Your card is
> not that old. It's part of the GeForce4 series
> which is one series
> before GeForce FX (in case anyone didn't know).
> The 56.64 drivers
> support your card. Also, to reduce headaches,
> set a restore point
> before upgrading the video drivers. I prefer to
> uninstall and re-
> install drivers in Safe Mode. In this way,
> you're sure the system
> isn't using any of the driver files.
>
> If you look at SOE's required specs (forget
> recommended specs), I
> believe that your system meets or exceeds their
> requirements.
>
>
>
http://eqlive.station.sony.com/support/tech_support/ts_system_require
> ments.jsp
>
> And, this is SOE's guide to the DirectX 9.0b
> upgrade:
>
>
http://eqlive.station.sony.com/news_section/newsview.jsp?story=61536
>
> Just a thought.
> -Arthiliel
>
>
> ~~~~~~~~~
>
> And on the eighth day God said, "O.K. Murphy. You
> take over."
> http://home.comcast.net/~melanieroark
>
